question: Who's behind these NFTs?
answer: This project is a collaboration between the Big Head Club team, filmmaker Jason Reitman (Ghostbusters: Afterlife director/writer), and Gil Kenan (Ghostbusters: Afterlife writer). All sanctioned by Ghost Corps and Sony Pictures Entertainment. The Mini-Puft collectible was inspired by the original designs of Canadian artist, Vochelle Yum, the Creative Director for the collection.

question: Where are you distributing the NFTs?
answer:
Each of the 10 Motion Vignettes will be available on OpenSea.
The 10,500 Mini-Pufts collectables will be available here.

question: How will you distribute them?
answer:
One Motion Vignette will be released for each of our Days of Afterlife. Each one will only be available for auction for a 24-hour period on OpenSea.
The 10,500 Mini-Puft collectables will be released in 4 stages.
  1. Pre-sale exclusively for members of the Big Head Club community and will be open for 2 hours.
  2. We'll open up reservations for 24 hours, or until they sell out. Anyone can reserve a Mini-Puft NFT — you'll pay the full price up front, plus a small gas fee. Then, you can come back anytime after the claim phase begins, to optimize gas fees. This saves you eth!
  3. We'll open up for direct minting until they sell out.
  4. Finally, we’ll put aside 500 known as “The Mob.” They are extra spicy and will run around Mini-Puft owners’ wallets, if you come across one AND have the Ghost Trap NFT, you can capture one for free.

question: How much will the 10,500 collectibles cost?
What are Mini-Pufts?
answer: They're mischievous little paranormal creatures from the film Ghostbusters: Afterlife. Mint a NFT of a unique Mini-Puft and own it forever.

question: How many Mini-Pufts can be minted per transaction?
answer: During the pre-sale for Big Head Club members, 2 per wallet. After that, 10 per transaction.

question: How many traits will the Mini-Pufts have? How rare are they?
answer: There are around 225 very unique traits, ranging in chaos and rarity.

question: What are gas fees?
answer: Gas fees are the standard costs of doing a transaction on the Ethereum blockchain. We don't control them, nor do we profit from them. The higher the demand, the higher the gas fee—kinda like Uber surge pricing (so we are finding ways to try to avoid that).

question: How are we addressing the environmental impact?
answer: For the launch of this project, we are offsetting the expected carbon emissions through Sony’s Global Environmental Plan.

question: How will you avoid gas wars?
answer: To help minimize the gas fees you pay — and to avoid a possible gas war — we've come up with the reservation system. Instead of minting an NFT directly (which incurs a higher gas fee), you just 'secure' your order, then come back and mint it once gas fees are lower.

question: How do I qualify for the Reservation Presale?
answer: You'll have to have a qualifying Big Head Club NFT in your wallet when we take a snapshot of the blockchain. Having multiple Big Head Club NFTs doesn't give you any advantage in the Reservation Presale, nor does it allow you to purchase additional Mini-Pufts.

question: How does the Reservation Presale work?
answer: Anyone with a qualifying Big Head Club NFT in their wallet when we take a blockchain snapshot (see above) will be eligible to buy 2 Mini-Pufts during the Reservation Presale.

question: How does reserving work?
answer:
Anyone with an Ethereum wallet and enough eth can participate in the reservation phase.

During the reservation phase, you'll pay the full purchase price of your NFT, plus a smaller gas fee. (This transaction costs less gas than minting the actual NFT). This secures your specific NFT, but helps avoid expensive gas wars.

Then, you can come back later at a time that suits you, click 'Mint,' and mint your actual NFT. You will have to pay gas for this second transaction, but altogether this process saves you money.

question: How does the public sale work?
answer: You can mint up to 10 per transaction during the public sale. This is your standard NFT-minting sale — one transaction, plus whatever the gas fee is at the time.

question: How do traps work?
answer: There will be 500 Mini-Pufts roaming the wallets of Mini-Puft NFT holders. They'll randomly appear for an hour at a time (or so), and then they'll leave again. But! You can trap one. To do so, you'll need to have a Trap NFT in your wallet. Then — while the roaming Mini-Puft is still in your wallet — visit our 'Trap' page, and click the ACTIVATE TRAP button.

question: Where do I get a trap?
answer: We're releasing 1,000 for free — but there aren’t enough for everyone. Big Head Club token holders can claim one here on the site or if they’re all gone, find one on OpenSea.

question: How will I know if a Mini-Puft visits my wallet?
answer: You won’t, unless you check back often.
